title: Fonts at the End of the Nazi Era
content:
For historians, I have uploaded a handy overview of the foundry type (hand composition) fonts available by German type foundries at the end of the Nazi era:

[http://www.sanskritweb.net/fontdocs/#NAZI](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907162204/http:/www.sanskritweb.net/fontdocs/#NAZI "http://www.sanskritweb.net/fontdocs/#NAZI")

 [‹ Linotype redoes and expands Meridien - now "Frutiger Serif"](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907162204/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45345 "Go to previous forum topic") [as I wander through the graveyard ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907162204/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45298 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Uli
